meta_description: Learn calories in a glass of white wine—about 125 kcal per 150 ml serving—plus carbs, alcohol details, and tweaks for different styles.
h1: Calories in a Glass of White Wine
assumptions: Standard 150 ml serving of dry white wine, ~12% ABV, no added mixers or garnishes.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by wine type, brand, ABV, sweetness, and serving size. Check labels or apps for specifics.

quick_answer.text: A standard glass of white wine contains about 125 calories, primarily from alcohol.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a glass of white wine?
faqs.a: Approximately 125 kcal for a standard 150 ml dry white wine.
Yes, about 3.8 g carbs per glass, mostly from residual sugars.

faqs.q: Is white wine lower in calories than red?
faqs.a: Similar—red wine is around 125-130 kcal per glass; varies by type.

faqs.q: What affects calories in white wine?
faqs.a: ABV, sweetness level, and serving size; sweeter or higher-alcohol wines have more.

faqs.q: Are there calories from alcohol in white wine?
faqs.a: Yes, alcohol contributes ~7 kcal per gram; a 12% ABV glass has ~14 g alcohol.
